body:
- Fixed string cast that caused failure in linux
- Added public init for TimePeriodGroup

- Nixed unnecessary optionality in formatter requests
- Added watchos support
- Fixed Swift Package Manager support

name: 2.0.0 - Swift
body:
- Swift is now supported. CocoaPod support is incoming
- More documentation to come!

name: 2.0.0-beta.3 - Swift
body: Final beta release for DateTools in Swift. Full API support and stable method signatures. All tests pass!

name: 2.0.0-beta.1 - Swift
body: First beta release for DateTools in Swift. A lot of core functionality is online but is yet untested/unverified.

name: 1.7.0 - Carthage Update
body:
- Added carthage integration
- Added sameDay methods with unit tests
- Fixed japanese localization
- Fixed missing file bug in unit test project that caused it not to build
- Restructured timeAgo methods for ease of stability, bookkeeping
- Fixed bug with and added new tests for timeAgo dates between 24&48 hours. The no longer render an incorrect number of hours
- Added tests for isWeekend method

A big thank you for all the new contributors in this release!

name: 1.6.0 - Cocoa Pods fix and language updates
body:
This release fixes the bundling issues with cocoa pods.

Added:
- Croatian localization
- Two new date parsing methods

Fixed:
- Chinese week translation
- Yesterday sometimes reporting when two days ago
- Cocoa pods bundle linking problems

name: 1.5.0 - New Features, Languages and Bug Fixes
body:
- Added short format support for Japanese, Chinese (Trad. & Simp.), Turkish
- Added numeric times for English ("1 second ago" instead of "Just Now")
- Added two new date creation methods that build a date by parts
- Added new method to determine if date is on a weekend

name: 1.4.3 - Fixed Deprecations
body: - Fixed the NSCalendarUnit and NSCalendarIdentifier deprecations

name: 1.4.2 - OSX Target Compatability
body: Added OSX target compatibility to cocoapods

name: 1.4.1 - Fixed Leap Year
body: - @waterskier2007  fixed typo in the isLeapYear function

name: Fixed warnings, new shortened translations
body:
- Fixed NSDateComponents warnings #30 
- New shortened timeAgo translations for English, Spanish, Czech, German and Romanian

name: 1.3.0 - New translation and helper methods
body:
- Added Welsh translation
- Added new isToday, isYesterday, isTomorrow methods

name: 1.2.1 - Improved Translation Rules and Localization
body:
- Added improved translation rules for Russian and Ukrainian "timeAgo" translations
- Updated localization call to use current app localization instead of the device localization

name: 1.2.0 - New Translations and Speed Bump
body:
- Added Translations:
  - Basque
  - Catalan
  - Indonesian
- Sped up and reduced allocations in formatters

name: 1.1.0 - Localizations and Speed Boost
body:
v1.1.0 includes:

**Localizations**
The merging in of the NSDate+TimeAgo library. This includes built in localizations for the following langauges:
- en (English)
- es (Spanish)
- zh_Hans (Chinese Simplified)
- zh_Hant (Chinese Traditional)
- pt (Portuguese)
- fr (French)
- it (Italian)
- ru (Russian)
- de (German)
- nl (Dutch)
- hu (Hungarian)
- fi (Finnish)
- ja (Japanese)
- vi (Vietnamese)
- ro (Romanian)
- da (Danish)
- cs (Czech)
- nb (Norwegian)
- lv (Latvian)
- tr (Turkish)
- ko (Korean)
- bg (Bulgarian)
- he (Hebrew)
- ar (Arabic)
- gre (Greek)
- pl (Polish)
- sv (Swedish)
- th (Thai)
- uk (Ukrainian)
- is (Icelandic)

**Speed Boost**
DateTools now instantiates a single instance of NSCalendar, thereby saving allocations on future calls requiring it. Tests saw around a 30-40% improvement in speed.

**Lower Minimum SDK**
The minimum required SDK was lowered to 6.0 from 6.1

name: DateTools 1.0
body:
The initial release of DateTools for Objective-C. With DateTools, you can:
- Easily work with dates and times through a helpful NSDate category
- Create and manipulate time periods
- Create and manipulate collections of time periods
